title: An atom with 15 protons and 18 electrons has a charge of what? - Quora

response.answer_text: You gots 15 nuclear protons, each massive particle with a FORMAL positive charge, and 18 extranuclear electrons, i.e. 18 species of negligible mass but with a FORMAL negative charge… And thus the charge of the nuclide is [math]15–18=-3[/math]. Agreed? And as a matter of fact we can be more specific, and identify the ion as [math]P^{3-}[/math]. How can I do this…?

I think since 15 protons and electrons will balance out the charges their sum of charges would be zero plus 3 electrons -1.6*10^-19(3) Total charge of the atom will be -4.8*10^-19 will be the total charge of the atom remember that protons and electrons have the same charges but slightly different masses
